But you might be able to compensate for this by restricting debate enough to give everyone time to read what has been posted and then reply.
 
 You could do a quorum call by posting a resolution and then waiting a certain amount of time while asking the participants to post a note (or send an email to the moderator/chairman) saying they have read the resolution and want to debate it. If a majority of the participants do not respond within the set time period, the resolution would have to be removed from the order of business- or it could be sent to a committee so it can be discussed by a number of participants that is less than a majority. Then once the resolution has been refined by the committee it can re-introduced for another quorum call.
